title: Your Roadmap is a Prototype for Your Strategy
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-10, Reading time: 12 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.prodpad.com%2Fblog%2Froadmap-prototype-strategy%2F%3Futm_source=tldrfounders/1/0100019a6de14789-db3b82e2-7ae3-452a-8167-d55105851cc6-000000/46M5BEIUjq2paXKXC-drs_RKsV4qPzbKs5iPDnqVcrc=430
summary: Your Roadmap is a Prototype for Your Strategy (12 minute read) Product roadmaps should be treated as prototypes, focusing on adaptability and learning, rather than rigid delivery contracts. A flexible roadmap, like the Now-Next-Later model, encourages teams to test assumptions, iterate based on feedback, and keep strategies aligned with changing environments. By emphasizing the process over the end product, roadmapping builds resilience and ensures strategies remain relevant and effective.

summary: Founder Ideology (5 minute read) Every founder builds from a different place. Some are missionaries who believe deeply in a mission, others are mercenaries who love the chase. There are performers too - the rebels who bend the rules and the ones who fake it until it breaks. People move between these types as they grow, fail, or win. What matters most isn't which one you start as, but who you're becoming while you build.

summary: OpenAI's $1 Trillion Infrastructure Spend (17 minute read) OpenAI has committed to spending $1.15 trillion on hardware and cloud infrastructure between 2025 and 2035. title: Quantization is not a compromise — it's the next paradigm

summary: Quantization is not a compromise — it's the next paradigm (3 minute read) K2-Thinking's release has led many developers to be curious about its native INT4 quantization format. title: What should you do if a colleague steals your creative idea?
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-11, Reading time: 7 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fwww.creativeboom.com%2Ftips%2Fwhat-should-you-do-if-a-colleague-steals-your-creative-idea%2F%3Futm_source=tldrdesign/1/0100019a7305d522-9ec38591-193a-41aa-a2b5-f0b419c599ce-000000/A7Gwhc7Of-_XQHj3692mRi9MFD3JqVs_ywJCQN4OhAg=430
summary: What should you do if a colleague steals your creative idea? (7 minute read) Idea theft at work is common and undermines respect and professional credibility. The recommended approach is to document your contributions, address the colleague privately and respectfully, reclaim ownership during meetings if needed, escalate to management with evidence if the behaviour persists, and strategically protect your ideas, while knowing when to prioritize your wellbeing in toxic environments.

summary: The 4.5 trillion dollar elephant in the room (25 minute read) Nvidia, currently valued at $4.5 trillion, is the most valuable company on Earth and the dominant supplier of AI chips. A pattern of fear around the company is impacting policy discussion. There are claims that the major AI companies disagree with Nvidia's policy stances, but are unwilling to speak out because Nvidia has the power to undermine their business. This article looks at the evidence of such claims.

title: Omnilingual ASR
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-11, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Ffacebookresearch%2Fomnilingual-asr%3Futm_source=tldrai/1/0100019a7346e404-6b4fae15-4f6e-42d6-8220-0e366ad1ed7e-000000/BJijgs1mFP0uTslHiSQWDNd-G4ENJ7e3avmoeEwKuQE=430
summary: Omnilingual ASR (GitHub Repo) Omnilingual ASR is a speech recognition system that supports over 1,600 languages, with hundreds never before covered by other ASR technology. New languages can be added with just a few paired examples without specialized expertise or large datasets. Omnilingual ASR is designed for broad accessibility - it is aimed at making speech technology more inclusive and adaptable for communities and researchers worldwide.

title: AMA With Moonshot AI, The Open-source Frontier Lab Behind Kimi K2 Thinking Model
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-11, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Flinks.tldrnewsletter.com%2Fw55WVG/1/0100019a7346e404-6b4fae15-4f6e-42d6-8220-0e366ad1ed7e-000000/-97H79I3Kfk9Del0eh1KEokWE0PZS2MTbrynIvEhk3E=430
summary: AMA With Moonshot AI, The Open-source Frontier Lab Behind Kimi K2 Thinking Model (Reddit Thread) Moonshot AI's Kimi K2 is a Mixture-of-Experts model with 32 billion activated parameters and 1 trillion total parameters. It achieves state-of-the-art performance in frontier knowledge, math, and coding among non-thinking models and also has agentic abilities. Kimi-K2-Base and Kimi-K2-Instruct were recently open sourced. This thread contains a discussion with the team at Moonshot AI.

title: Vertical Integration is the Only Thing That Matters
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-12, Reading time: 13 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fbecca.ooo%2Fblog%2Fvertical-integration%2F%3Futm_source=tldrnewsletter/1/0100019a77ce96f3-060653d9-8d2e-4256-9ae2-48d443214046-000000/0IGrxtz0EnsRi2OVRD50DOHrY1QdIL9sJo7wrRwAado=431
summary: Vertical Integration is the Only Thing That Matters (13 minute read) The inability of developer productivity startups to vertically integrate their offerings has hindered their adoption and utility. Vertical integration refers to a tight integration between different tools in a stack. Being unable to ship the whole stack means limiting the features you can provide. 'Glue code' is what makes this all work.

title: Scaling HNSWs
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-12, Reading time: 25 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fantirez.com%2Fnews%2F156%3Futm_source=tldrnewsletter/1/0100019a77ce96f3-060653d9-8d2e-4256-9ae2-48d443214046-000000/gHjQwz2dnE62fRe28HZdFnhsJwMRvlkObixSeB14rXE=431
summary: Scaling HNSWs (25 minute read) The Hierarchical Navigable Small World (HNSW) algorithm is a graph-based approximate nearest neighbor search technique used in many vector databases. This post shares advanced findings on HNSWs. HNSWs are resistant to low latency and high performance, so the post is focused on making them fast enough to allow for a 'Redis' experience. It covers the challenges involved in exposing HNSWs as abstract data structures.

title: Galaxy brain resistance
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-12, Reading time: 25 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fvitalik.eth.limo%2Fgeneral%2F2025%2F11%2F07%2Fgalaxybrain.html%3Futm_source=tldrnewsletter/1/0100019a77ce96f3-060653d9-8d2e-4256-9ae2-48d443214046-000000/f8XyPFRQsiUYnQ3TrOL690h_1hFLxJvx-eF388_AmXs=431
summary: Galaxy brain resistance (25 minute read) If your arguments can justify anything, then they imply nothing. Arguments like these are almost always rationalizations. Galaxy brain resistance refers to how difficult it is to abuse an argument. Patterns of reasoning that are very low in galaxy brain resistance are common - this can have some extreme consequences. Markets like Brazil and Mexico show high smart TV usage.

summary: StyleX: A Styling Library for CSS at Scale (11 minute read) StyleX is Meta's default, open-source styling system. Designed for large-scale applications, it combines the ease of CSS-in-JS with the performance of static CSS generation. StyleX compiles styles at build time into atomic CSS. It enforces constraints to avoid conflict-prone patterns, like styling at a distance, to guarantee style encapsulation.

title: Zig / C++ Interop
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-13, Reading time: 4 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Ftuple.app%2Fblog%2Fzig-cpp-interop%3Futm_source=tldrwebdev/1/0100019a7d1e4742-8f3d64e8-9a07-4816-bba9-24e2a66579d6-000000/GKesvFOR9PLwRphPbOaHrxJKRwoVe3kVgNUgikJPGEg=431
summary: Zig / C++ Interop (4 minute read) Zig and C++ interoperability means that both languages can store each other's data types. A macro called `SIZED_OPAQUE` can be used to define opaque types with specified sizes and alignments, enabling type embedding and compile-time size verification. Pointers can be used for passing types between languages, and C++ functions can be used for managing types in Zig.

comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-13, Reading time: 7 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Fuxdesign.cc%2Fsynthetic-developer-the-solo-designers-best-friend-947ec304c9f4%3Futm_source=tldrdesign/1/0100019a7d531214-a6f188c0-a724-4e95-9078-4df601fc1480-000000/7FxDUJwT6h77I1y5-iI8IMbTQZjpiUGQZR2ILECVxZw=431
summary: Synthetic developer, the solo designer's best friend? (7 minute read) Designer Anna Lefour tested a “synthetic developer” powered by ChatGPT to simulate collaboration when no real developers were available. The AI helped structure ideas and explore technical options but lacked context, curiosity, and human insight. She concluded that AI can support, not replace, collaboration. It is best used as a preparation tool before real developer discussions in a hybrid workflow.

title: The end of the back office
comment: Source: TLDR Newsletter, Date: 2025-11-13, Reading time: 10 minute read, Links: https://tracking.tldrnewsletter.com/CL0/https:%2F%2Ffintechtakes.com%2Farticles%2F2025-11-12%2Fthe-end-of-the-back-office%2F%3Futm_source=tldrfintech/1/0100019a7d8a74ea-577beca6-fe7d-4b15-9f7c-ecdb0867f0d1-000000/-O9eSH-YSgje-9wIkfSSWZSTdig20k2Yjxs4BXJ_kE0=431
summary: The end of the back office (10 minute read) Software reduced paperwork but spawned tool sprawl. The breakthrough now is subtraction, not speed - eliminating back-office work rather than accelerating it. We're moving from “do it yourself/with you” to “do it for you”: agentic AI handles clear, time-consuming tasks (e.g., W-9 collection and receipt categorization), while humans handle only exceptions.
